Column Comment.0: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.1: VOTING PROCEDURE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the voting procedure.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DEFEAT COUNT: the number of negative otes that must be received in order todefeat a vote.
Column Comment.4: DEFEAT PERCENT: The percent of votes that must be received in the negative todefeat a vote.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: PERCENT INTEREST: the percentage of interest that must be represented in orderfor a vote to be passed or defeated - similar to quorum except that this representsinterest, rather than number of parties.
Column Comment.8: NO VOTE RESPONSE: In the event that a response is not received from a party, theresponse that is deemed to have been made. May be Postive or Negative, agree ordisagree, for or against etc.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: QUORUM COUNT: The number of voters who must be represented to achievequorum.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: RESPONSE PERIOD: The time that participants have to respond to the vote.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.16: CONTRACT VOTING PROCEDURE TYPE: The type of voting procedure that iscaptured, such as general operations, enlargment, exhibits.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
